prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. For the sketch, draw a rectangle on face 1 of the coordinate system. The rectangle should consist of 4 lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.75, 0) 2. Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0), End Point (0.75, 0.5625) 3. Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.5625), End Point (0, 0.5625) 4. Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.5625), End Point (0, 0) To complete the part, extrude the sketch by 0.4687 units in the positive normal direction. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and a flat bottom. Create a new coordinate system at (0.2812, 0.1875, 0.4687) with no rotation. Draw a circle on face 1 of the coordinate system. The circle should have the following properties: 1. Center (0.0937, 0.0937) 2. Radius 0.0937 Extrude the circle by 0.1406 units in the positive normal direction. Part 3: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system at (0.2776, 0, 0.1219) with a rotation of -90 degrees around the z-axis. On face 1 of the coordinate system, draw a hexagon with lines connecting each vertex. The vertices of the hexagon should be defined as follows: 1. Point 1: (0, 0.0562) 2. Point 2: (0.0974, 0.0) 3. Point 3: (0.1949, 0.0562) 4. Point 4: (0.1949, 0.1687) 5. Point 5: (0.0974, 0.225) 6. Point 6: (0, 0.1687) Extrude the shape in the negative normal direction by 0.0469 units. The resulting shape will have a height of 0.225 units, a length of 0.225 units, and a width of 0.0469 units. After constructing the individual parts, perform the necessary boolean operations to combine or cut out the parts as needed to create the final shape. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on top, centered, and with a diameter equal to the height of the prism. The prism will be placed on a flat surface.</description>
